meanings.definition: The state or quality of being lighthearted or cheerful.
meanings.sent1: The children's laughter filled the room with gaieties.
meanings.sent2: The park was full of gaieties during the summer festival.
meanings.sent3: The clown's silly antics added to the gaieties of the party.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a beacon of gaieties in the gloomy day.
meanings.sent5: The colorful balloons added a touch of gaieties to the event.

meanings.sent1: The town square was alive with gaieties during the holiday season.
meanings.sent2: The wedding was a grand affair filled with gaieties.
meanings.sent3: The gaieties of the carnival brought joy to all who attended.
meanings.sent4: The gaieties of the parade painted the streets with happiness.
meanings.sent5: The gaieties of the festival were a sight to behold.
